name: Josiah's lodgings
blotter: An agreeable evening awaits with your old friend Josiah.
He lives at the Travellers' Club, ancient haunt of explorers and spies
You pause at the door. Something's not right.

menu.label: Knock
result: A terrible noise. You force the door.
Through blowing curtains, a shadowy figure flees over the terrae and is gone
Josiah's corpse lies on the floor, his blood drained

menu.label: Contemplation
help: The still of the night, of death,
all senses strained for the slightest clue
result: You're drawn to a printout on a shelf. An academic paper on lies. You sit and read
It seems lieing is hard: hard to keep the story straight.
The paper outlines a way to use artificial intelligence to maintain a set of lies.

menu.label: Rage!
help: Draw on the beast within for extra strength. To the death!
result: Using your unnatural strength, the fight is short, brutal and lethally balanced.
You tear him apart. Your wounds are grave. His corpse fades to dusty wind.
Josiah's wardrobe replaces your torn clothes. Your appearance fades back to human.

menu.label: Attack
help: To attack in human form would be suicide
result: Your enemy springs. The fight is short, brutal and one-sided.
Fighting in human form, you are torn apart. Hells fires welcome you.

menu.label: Leave
help: Best not to hang about. This would be hard to explain to the police.
result: Despite your inner turmoil, you appear calm as you stroll out onto Pall Mall.

menu.label: The desk
result: Ashes of a letter in the ash-tray.
Yet you work out its gist from the pen's faint imprint on the leather desk.
Josiah wrote to warn you of a plot to end truth, a computer of lies, that he must flee

menu.label: Roof terrace
help: His room overlooks the roof terrace.
You could peek through his window. This might annoy him.
result: You see the vampire Anton drinking the last of Josiah's life
